Regaining Food Sovereignty Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Regaining Food Sovereignty Called for in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The "National Federation of Peasants Associations" and the "National Federation of Women Peasants Associations" of south Korea reportedly called a press conference on Mar. 27 at which they vowed to protect locally produced rice and thus regain the food sovereignty usurped by the U.S.
 Speakers there declared that they would launch strong actions against the storage of American rice.
 It is a movement for regaining the food sovereignty to prevent the ships carrying American rice from entering ports and the rice silos from keeping it in storage, a press release declared, threatening to boycott the American rice while conducting the above-said actions.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Highly Praised
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Highly Praised 
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The exploits leader          Kim Jong Il has performed as a great strategist by converting the DPRK into a military power were highly praised at functions held in different countries on the occasions of the 13th anniversary of his election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 74th anniversary of the foundation of the heroic Korean People's Army.
 Seminars, lectures, photo exhibitions, film shows and a friendly meeting took place in Tanzania, South Africa, the Czech Republic and Ethiopia between Mar. 18 and 23.
 A deputy secretary of the Maritime Regional Committee of the Revolutionary Party of Tanzania said at a seminar that Kim Jong Il set out a Songun political mode to cope with the high-handed and arbitrary practices of the allied forces of the imperialists and has led the Korean people along the road of victory with his outstanding Songun leadership, thereby making a great contribution to the human cause of independence.
 The deputy secretary of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party said at a lecture titled "Korean People's Army demonstrating its invincibility under the distinguished brilliant commander" that the KPA has grown to be an army, which no one dares provoke, under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il as it has a glorious tradition and history in which it defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists.    
 The chairman of the Ethiopian Youth Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said at a friendly meeting that Kim Jong Il is a great strategist who has turned the DPRK into a military power with his Songun politics, adding that the Korean people led by him have firmly defended their sovereignty from the high-handed and arbitrary practices of the U.S.

articles.content:
Greetings to Afghan Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Rangeen Dadfar Spanta on his appointment as foreign minister of Afghanistan.
 Extending warm congratulations to him, the message sincerely wished him success in his work.

articles.title: New Kind of Fodder Additive Developed
articles.content:
New Kind of Fodder Additive Developed
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Scientists in the applied mineral institute under the Geological Faculty of Kim Il Sung University have recently developed a new kind of fodder additive to boost meat and egg production on the basis of high-technology and resources rich in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 The existing premix is a kind of quick fattening additives providing domestic animals with essential amino acids and anti-biotic elements that cannot be synthesized in their bodies.    
 The newly developed premix contains mineral microelements and vitamins.
 Dr. Ri Ui Jong, who played a leading part in the developing team, said his team increased the kinds of the essential microelements in the former premix by over 20 so as to boost their proportion up to that of sea-water. The new premix promotes metabolism, digestion and absorption of animals and makes them produce large amounts of essential amino acids in their bodies so as to raise fattening and egg-laying rate, he added.
 The premix additive has been applied to the Hungju Chicken Farm and various other poultry farms of the country where meat and egg production has remarkably increased.
 For the chickens which were fed with the new premix for over 40 days, their egg-laying rate rose by 85.4 percent and the survival rate by 95 percent in the average. And for the ducks, the survival rate rose by 98 percent and their egg-laying rate by 80 percent. The weight increment of the pig fed with the new premix is 1.2 kilograms a day.
 The blood test of the animals shows that the numbers of red corpuscle, hemoglobin, platelet and GPT went up by 30.6, 32.7, 59.9 and 12.5 percent respectively.
 Meanwhile, a factory with a capacity of producing thousands of tons of new premix a year has been built to supply it to poultry farms throughout the country.

articles.title: Angling Encouraged in DPRK
U.S. Aerial Espionage against DPRK in March
articles.content:
U.S. Aerial Espionage against DPRK in March
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists committed more than 180 cases of aerial espionage against the DPRK by mobilizing reconnaissance planes with different missions in March while staging large-scale "RSOI" and "Foal Eagle" joint military exercises targeted on the DPRK, according to a military source.
 They let a U-2 and RC-135 fly for intensively spying on major strategic targets and military installations in areas of the north side. 
 Their RC-7B and RC-12 and other type tactical reconnaissance planes committed nearly 150 cases of espionage in March.    
 A special mention should be made of the fact that from Mar. 25 to 31 they sent an overseas-based E-3 almost every day on a mission to command more than 2,000 fighters involved in "RSOI" and "Foal Eagle" joint military exercises for aggression and spy on the areas of the north.
